meanings.definition: A bundle of items wrapped or boxed together for carrying or shipping.
meanings.sent1: I received two packages in the mail today.
meanings.sent2: The delivery person dropped off several packages at our doorstep.
meanings.sent3: The packages were so heavy that I almost dropped them!
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a package that she carried with her everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The packages were neatly stacked, ready to be shipped out.

meanings.definition: A software or data file that is bundled together for distribution and installation.
meanings.sent1: I downloaded the software package for my new computer.
meanings.sent2: The email contained multiple software packages for us to install.
meanings.sent3: The software package was so easy to use, even my grandma could do it!
meanings.sent4: The data package was like a treasure chest full of valuable information.
meanings.sent5: The software packages were updated regularly to ensure security.

meanings.definition: A set of proposals or measures offered as a single unit.
meanings.sent1: The government presented a new economic packages to stimulate growth.
meanings.sent2: The company's new policy package included benefits for all employees.
meanings.sent3: The proposal package was so well-received that it got approved immediately.
meanings.sent4: Her plan was like a carefully crafted package, ready to be unwrapped.
meanings.sent5: The packages of measures were designed to address various issues simultaneously.
